page.title: 10Wymondham College
page.content: The College site was a golf course from 1906 until the second World War. The site was then turned into an American Army hospital with many nissen huts and other temporary buildings, including a large water tower. The site was then used for various purposes including teacher training. In 1953 the site was first used as a boarding school, using the existing nissen huts. The pupils of Thorpe Grammar School also came to the site until their own buildings were complete. Another school, the County Grammar School was started on the site, but the buildings for this were never built and the pupils became day pupils of Wymondham College. Wymondham College, which is a state school, became the largest coeducational boarding school in europe. SC21CS
